Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=LeqUHNQYSErj2BcuiMBE56WY8ncDMQAtqyIHv8lL9VNMMN7r

Ilja Preuss wrote:

> With your reasoning it seems to me that even private == published in Java,
> because private doesn't hold me from accessing a member, if I really want
> to. Might just be me, though.

Using reflection is ugly and so hard to use compared to direct access, 
that' it's really not the same thing. Plus if you do it you know you're 
doing something skanky. And it's potentially controlled by the 
SecurityManager. Personally I still think it's questionable, and I'm not 
sure I approve of it being in the language, but its presence certainly 
doesn't justify making things public that shouldn't be.


--
